intro: Grisebachia parviflora subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy small-flowered grisebachia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy foliage, which distinguishes it from other members of the species. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
